At this stage, the next concrete step on our side is simply to keep the remaining place uncommitted while we wait to see whether any higher-priority families for Nursery_B submit an application here (or become available to apply) over the next few rounds. Given your note that you hope to finalize within the next couple of rounds: an offer to you within that timeframe is possible, but I cannot promise it. If you have a firm deadline from another nursery, please tell us the round/date and we will do our best to give you a clear yes/no by then.

If you would like to be considered immediately if the place becomes available to you, the most helpful thing is for you to be ready to submit an [APPLY] again at short notice (you have already provided the key commitment information).

Sincerely,
Nursery_B Admissions

Nursery_B explicitly asked me to submit a fresh [APPLY] in round 11 to be considered immediately if the place becomes available. Given the history of holding for higher-priority families, I should reapply now, reiterate immediate acceptance readiness, and request a clear yes/no update as they indicated they could provide a clearer update in round 11.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_B,

Thank you for submitting your round-11 application as discussed.

Based on where we are in the process this round, we are now able to extend you an offer for our remaining place.

Please reply to confirm enrollment, and we will send the deposit/forms and next-step timeline the same day.

Sincerely,
Nursery_B Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Nursery_B quota is 1 and currently unfilled. Our true priority is D > A > B > C > E, so Parent_B is mid-high (3rd). Check likelihood of higher-priority applicants (Parent_D or Parent_A) coming: Parent_D ranks Nursery_B as 2nd (after Nursery_D) and Nursery_D ranks Parent_D 2nd (after Parent_B). Parent_B ranks Nursery_D 4th, so Parent_B likely not taking Nursery_D; Nursery_D likely matches Parent_D, making Parent_D unavailable to us. Parent_A ranks Nursery_B 3rd (after D and A). Nursery_A ranks Parent_A 4th and may accept higher-priority E/C/D first; Parent_A may or may not end up with A. But after 11 rounds, neither D nor A has applied to us; holding longer risks ending unmatched. Accepting Parent_B now secures a decent (3rd-choice) priority match and avoids vacancy, with low expected chance of later upgrading to D or A given their preference/priorities elsewhere. Therefore accept.
